div.p: MS papers 37, folder 97, Alexander Turnbull Library, Wellington.

To proof.
I think that Mueller may be a little proud of his C.M.G. The Order has been reorganized especially for Colonial services, & no one has received the C. here, of lower rank than first Secretaries of Colonies & very few of these. Our distinctions are very rare things indeed — & being given for Service , not for scientific attainments as such — represent always very distinguished public services. As it is [...] [...] any living Botanist who can boast of a recognition from the crown of the sort & I cannot wonder that he is proud I feel it to be my duty to press his claims most strongly for a recognition from the Crown & this I did quite irrespective of his personal love of such decorations — which in this sense are but baubles.We have no decorations given as [Foreign] orders here, & I hope never shall be fore mere scientific attainments, of which no Govt can judge.
